question: 同日
sourceMnemonic: You have the <kanji>same</kanji> <kanji>day</kanji>, which comes out to <vocabulary>same day</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>日</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

On the <vocabulary>same day</vocabulary>, you once ate two entire <reading>dou</reading>ghnuts. <reading>Gee, two</reading> (<ja>どうじつ</ja>) on the same day? How did that feel?
